p: Territory of Washington County of Spokane}ss
In the District Court, Fourth Judicial District holding terms at Spokane Falls.
The Territory of Washington vs. Ray Raymond

W.A. Dandary being duly sworn on his oath deposes and says: That he now is and for the past Thirteen years has been a resident of the precinct of Shougle in Spokane County Washington Territory, That he is well acquainted with the people of said precinct and has personal acquaintance with a large share of time. That he is engaged in the mercantile backing in said precinct.

Said applicant further avests that he has been informed of the above entitled action
for some time and knows the same is now packing in our said court.

Applicant further avows that he has neber heard any expressions of prejudice against Ray Raymond by the people of said precinct of Spaugle and he believes that if such prejudice existed he would have heard the same. Applicant further avows that he has never heard the said cause much discussed by the people of said precinct and what discussion there was been was principle by at the time of the homicide. That applicant believes that the occasion of the people of changed precinct are not acquainted with the alleged faces in said case and have formed no opinion as to the guilt or innocence of the defendant in their action. Applicant further says that there are
about four hundred people living in said precinct, and that applicant verily believes a hundred jury now could be summoned from said Spougle precinct qualified by law to serve as jurors in said above named action and who are not prejudiced against the defendant in said action, and who have not heard the alleged facts selecting there toand have formed no opinion as to the guilt or innocence of said defendant and further applicant saith not.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 10th day of December A.D. 1886.
